title.narrative: PEID, Priority Environmental Infrastructure for Development

description.narrative: The PEID (Priority Environmental Infrastructure for Development) project aims to develop Serbia's investment pipeline for environmental infrastructure projects (solid waste and waste water) to the point of financing by providing technical assistance. Special focus is given to waste water investment preparations in the City of Nis and the City of Cacak. PEID support will strengthen Serbia in achieving the EU standards for waste water treatment. The project is implemented by a procured consultant, EPTISA, in cooperation with the Ministry of Environmental Protection in Serbia, and the Department for Project Management (DPM).

Miljöinfrastrukturprojektet PEID (Priority Environmental Infrastructure for Development) genomförs av bolaget EPTISA vilka vann en internationell konkurrensupphandling. Projeket påbörjades 2016-09-01. Projektets målsättning är att ge stöd till miljöministeriet att ta fram anbudsunderlag som uppfyller EUs krav (JASPERS) för vattenreningsverk och avfallsdeponier vilket kan finansieras med en mix av medel från serbiska staten, EU medel (IPA) och internationella finansiering institut. Projektet avslutas efter förlängning i december 2022.

The PEID project is implemented by the EPTISA Company which won an international bidding. The project aims to assist the Ministry of Environmental Protection to prepare tender documents fulfilling EU standards (JASPERS) for Waste Water Treatment Plants (WWTP) and Solid Waste Landfills for financing by a mix of national funding, EU Instrument Pre Accession (IPA) and International Financing Institutions (IFI). The PEID project will provide technical to the Serbian Ministry of Environmental Protection as part of a process of capability and capacity development. The project has been extended and concludes end of 2022.

tag.narrative: 6.3 - By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally.

6.3 - Till 2030 förbättra vattenkvaliteten genom att minska föroreningar, stoppa dumpning och minimera utsläpp av farliga kemikalier och material, halvera andelen obehandlat avloppsvatten och väsentligt öka återvinningen och en säker återanvändning globalt.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Priority Environmental Infrastructure for Development (PEID) project has come to its last phase with the finalization of the technical documentation for the tender dossiers that has been prepared to be build in the Serbian cities of Nis and Cacak. The construction is planned to be financed mainly through EU IPA funding, which means that Swedish funding has been catalytic to prepare for large-scale investments. The preparation of tender documents for waste water treatment plants aim at increasing the capacity on central as well as local level for the planning, construction and management of large environmental infrastructure projects. Serbia has only a few waste water treatment facilities and will need to build a large number of facilities to reach EU environmental standards and, importantly, decrease pollution and improve the status of environment. The most important change the program has led to so far is the increased knowledge amongst Serbian authorities, on national and local level, on the process and requirements according to EU and Serbian law in preparing waste water treatment investments. Also, during last year, major communication events have been done locally to increase the knowledge on the technologies and benefits of waste water management and clean water.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
